intro: Mesembryanthemum baylissii, commonly known as the Cape Flats mesemb, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the ends of stems. Its fleshy leaves are adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
